meanings.definition: To give birth to a lamb or kid.
meanings.sent1: The sheep yeaned in the barn last night.
meanings.sent2: The goat yeaned two healthy kids this spring.
meanings.sent3: The farmer chuckled as he watched the ewe yean in the pasture.
meanings.sent4: The hills echoed with the sound of the ewe yeaned in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The young shepherd will never forget the first time he saw a ewe yeaned.

meanings.sent1: Last year, the ewe yeaned a healthy lamb.
meanings.sent2: The farmer proudly shared how the ewe yeaned without any complications.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled when they heard the story of how the ewe yeaned last spring.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the ewe yeaned flooded back to the shepherd as he walked through the meadow.
meanings.sent5: The old farmer's eyes sparkled as he recounted the day the ewe yeaned.
